definition: refuge/to take refuge/to seek asylum (political etc)
to avoid/to shun/to flee/to escape/to keep away from/to leave/to hide from

sentences.english: She has a little retreat in the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 她在山中有一处小小的避难所。

sentences.english: Black temporarily at cousin and good li-li jins asylum.
sentences.chinese: “黑皮”暂时在表妹和相好的金莉莉家避难。

sentences.english: They sought refuge in the mountain villages .
sentences.chinese: 他们到山村里寻找避难所。

sentences.english: Witnesses said the bomb hit the refugees as they were sheltering under trees and bushes.
sentences.chinese: 目击者称，难民在树林和树丛中避难时遭到炸弹袭击。

sentences.english: Workers built shelters for survivors whose homes had been destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 救援人员为那些家园被毁的幸存者盖起了避难所。

sentences.english: God is our shelter in life's storms.
sentences.chinese: 上帝是十号风球时的避难所。

sentences.english: They Prince was forced to take sanctuary at Westminster.
sentences.chinese: 王子被迫逃入西敏斯特教堂避难。

sentences.english: But he said insurgent leaders have been able to take refuge in Pakistan.
sentences.chinese: 同时他还声明叛乱领导人将在巴基斯坦避难。

sentences.english: Some swept away after clinging to rooftops.
sentences.chinese: 许多在屋顶避难的人被冲走。

sentences.english: Those tsunami victims are in evacuation centers.
sentences.chinese: 海啸的受害者们现在都在避难所里。

sentences.english: Two villages in the county were severely damaged and villagers are living in shelters.
sentences.chinese: 该县两个村庄严重受损，村民们都已住进了避难所。

sentences.english: These activities are organized in shelters, congregated groups and homes in devastated communities.
sentences.chinese: 这些活动在受灾人群密集的避难所进行组织。

sentences.english: And it shows just how prejudiced we can be about asylum-seekers.
sentences.chinese: 它显示出我们对寻求政治避难者多么的心怀偏见。

sentences.english: Many of the Shensi Muslims were driven from their homes and forced to take refuge in Kansu.
sentences.chinese: 陕西的很多穆斯林被赶出家园，被迫到甘肃寻求避难。

sentences.english: Many are living in school buildings or in makeshift roadside shelters .
sentences.chinese: 许多人住在学校或临时的路边避难处里。

definition: to run away from trouble/to flee from calamity/to be a refugee
to take refuge/to seek refuge from disaster
to run away/to go into exile
to force into exile/to be exiled/in exile
destitute and homeless (idiom); forced from one's home and wandering about/displaced
